channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: France's left-wing coalition thwarts far right in parliamentary run-off vote
item.description: A period of horse-trading and instability is now likely to take hold in France, as political alliances are forged with the aim of forming a government.

item.title: Democratic power players are circulating a proposal for Biden to exit, launch 'blitz primary'
item.description: President Biden is facing escalating pressure to drop out of the 2024 race against Donald Trump, following his high-profile debate flop.

item.title: The sting of an Airbnb rejection: Hosts explain why they turn down all sorts of travelers
item.description: Social media, credit cards that don't match booking names, and even 4.5-star reviews can cause short-term rental hosts to reject travelers outright.

item.title: Japan's stock markets keep testing new highs. Is the rally sustainable?
item.description: What lies ahead for the Japanese equity markets, now that they've scaled to new highs again?

item.title: India and China to 'redouble' efforts for resolving border issues 'at the earliest'
item.description: India and China have agreed to double down on efforts to improve talks regarding their long-drawn-out border issues.

item.title: Iran elects reformist Masoud Pezeshkian in presidential runoff vote
item.description: The 69-year-old former minister will serve for four years as the head of government for the Islamic Republic, and faces no shortage of challenges.

item.title: Who is Labour's Keir Starmer, the new leader of Britain?
item.description: The 61-year-old human rights lawyer-turned-politician has had a rapid ascent after entering parliament less than a decade ago.

item.title: Biden faces a 'vital week' to convince voters he can beat Trump, Sen. Murphy says
item.description: Five House Democrats so far have publicly called on President Biden to bow out of the 2024 race against Donald Trump.

item.title: Britain's Labour pulled off a thumping election victory with just 34% of the national vote
item.description: Unlike in other voting systems, there are no second rounds or ranking of first- and second-choice candidates.

item.title: Tesla shares wipe out loss for the year with 27% rally this week
item.description: After a dismal start to 2024, Tesla's stock has rallied sharply of late, including a 27% gain this week, to wipe out its loss for the year.

item.title: Southwest Airlines shareholders puzzled by Elliott's activism can look to past campaigns for insight
item.description: Elliott Management's $1.9 billion stake in Southwest Airlines has raised concern among investors who value the company's steadfast culture.

item.title: Can Israel's Iron Dome be overrun? System's capabilities in focus amid rising risk of war with Hezbollah
item.description: As Israel faces the prospect of a two-front war against Hamas and Hezbollah, military experts warn its advanced Iron Dome defense system could be overwhelmed.

item.title: The best—and worst—things about living in the U.S., according to expats living here
item.description: The U.S. ranks No. 35 out of 53 countries around the world for expats.

item.title: Biden defends mental health, vows to stay in race as House Democrats set weekend meeting
item.description: President Joe Biden spoke with ABC News anchor George Stephanopoulos during a campaign trip to Madison, Wisconsin.

item.title: Over $170 billion wiped off cryptocurrencies as market tanks on Mt. Gox bitcoin payout fears
item.description: Cryptocurrencies plunged on Friday as investors get anxious about the planned payout of nearly $9 billion to users of collapsed bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox.

item.title: Putin's Hungarian ally Orban draws EU ire over 'peace mission' to Moscow
item.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen warned that "appeasement will not stop Putin."

item.title: GlobalFoundries races to find semiconductor talent as demand for chips soars
item.description: GlobalFoundries and other semiconductor companies are looking for workers as demand for chips soars, spurred by CHIPS Act funding and artificial intelligence.

item.title: U.S. economy added 206,000 jobs in June, unemployment rate rises to 4.1%
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 200,000 in June, according to economists surveyed by Dow Jones.

item.title: Energy giant Shell to take up to a $2 billion impairment hit on Rotterdam, Singapore plants
item.description: Energy giant Shell on Friday said it expects to record a post-tax impairment hit of up to $2 billion mainly linked to its Singapore and Rotterdam plants.

item.title: Stocks, property, bonds, the pound: Here’s what a new Labour government means for investing in the UK
item.description: As Labour takes power in the U.K., experts weigh in on whether the change in government will impact stocks, bonds, the British pound and property markets.

item.title: Young, wealthy investors turn to alternatives instead of traditional stock and bond investments
item.description: If you're a young, wealthy investor, traditional stocks and bonds are probably not at the top of your investment wish list, research finds.

item.title: Outgoing UK PM Rishi Sunak quits as Conservative Party leader after crushing election defeat
item.description: Outgoing UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will step down as leader of the Conservative Party after the Labour Party secured a landslide victory in the election.

item.title: Mt. Gox begins repaying bitcoin to creditors a decade after exchange's collapse. What it means
item.description: Mt. Gox, the Japanese bitcoin exchange that collapsed into bankruptcy a decade ago, said Friday it has begun making repayments to creditors.

item.title: Germany seals 2025 budget plan after weeks of tense negotiations
item.description: German government leaders have agreed on an outline of the country’s 2025 budget after intense negotiations, coalition leaders announced.

item.title: Goldman Sachs upgrades UK growth forecast after huge Labour election win
item.description: Goldman Sachs upgraded its growth forecast for the U.K. after the Labour Party’s landslide victory in the country’s general election.

item.title: Trump ally Nigel Farage elected to British parliament for first time
item.description: After seven failed attempts, Nigel Farage has won a seat in the U.K.'s parliament.

item.title: U.S. named the worst place for British families to move abroad. Here's why
item.description: The U.S. comes in last in a ranking of 28 countries, dragged down by high childcare costs, long work hours and lack of federally mandated paid parental leave.

item.title: While much of Europe embraces hard-right parties, the UK has swung wildly to the left. Here’s why
item.description: An unexpected political shift has gripped Europe over the last few years.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: UK Labour landslide election victory
item.description: The center-left Labour Party has won a landslide victory, ending 14 years of Conservative rule.

item.title: Philippines to 'respond appropriately' to Chinese 'harassment' in South China Sea, military chief says
item.description: Filipino troops will 'respond appropriately' against future harassment from Chinese coast guards at the disrupted Second Thomas Shoal,
